results.title: Automation: what it is and what it does
results.brief_description: Explores the meaning and levels of automation from an electric can opener to transfer machines in an assembly line to the more sophisticated feed back of a computer controlled refinery. Encourages the student to explore the implications of increasing automation for the future. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Automation : see it now
results.creator_credit: Fred W Friendly and Edward Murrow
results.brief_description: A documentary report on the modern day industrial revolution, Automation. It traces the earlier mechanization in industry and shows the application of the newer automation in present-day industry. Between the extremes of considering automation a menace to our way of life, or as the solution of every problem, the film presents viewpoints on the subjects ranging from a working man to the head of I.B.M. All state it is inevitable. Automation is shown in such industries as the automotive, aviation, baking, electronics, manufacturing industries and many others.

results.title: Automatic self defence workout
results.brief_description: Hollywood star, Lorenzo Lamas, partners martial arts champions Cheryl Wheeler and Peter Luljuraj in a world first tape that features both aerobics and instruction in twelve basic moves of self defence. It’s the perfect way for men and women to have fun working out and learning stimulating self defence exercises. You will feel the power grow as you come to grips with the basic art of blocking, punching and kicking - and how to defend yourself against knife attack, or a sudden grab to the body or head.

results.title: Automatic process control
results.brief_description: Illustrates the advantages to be derived from applying automatic control to a process in a small chemical plant. The four modes of control are discussed: on/off; proportional; proportional with reset; proportional with reset and rate action. An application of instrumentation for continuous process control is explained.
results.description: Illustrates the advantages to be derived from applying automatic control to a process in a small chemical plant. results.title: Automania 2000
results.creator_credit: John Halas and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description: An animated satire on problems of automotive design and lack of proper roads and parking facilities. Shows what could happen in the year 2000 when people are forced to live in their cars and the car finally becomes able to reproduce itself. Animator: Harold Whitaker; Writer: Joy Batchelor.

results.title: Autograph
results.brief_description: One of 6 works selected by AIM director David Atkinson as representing the best interactive work produced by the AIM centre up until 2004. An interactive work focusing on the use of eloquent graphics and innovative interface screen design for navigation. The work deals with themes such as humanity, organics and technology. A beautiful work pioneering elegant design with an innovative interface. Invited for exhibition at the Young Talent Pavilion in MILIA, France in 1995.

results.title: Autobiography of a princess
results.creator_credit: James Ivory, Ismail Merchant and Merchant Ivory Productions
results.brief_description: An Indian rajah’s past is recalled by his exiled daughter (Madhur Jaffrey) and his ageing tutor (James Mason), interspersed with old movies from the rajah’s archives. An absorbing character study which also reveals something of the complexities and contradictions of India and the role of the British in India. Written by Ruth Prawer Jhabvala. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
